Posts.Content: Chuck, thank you for the information and the welcome...I'm 65, but in pretty good health, otherwise. My doctor strongly recommends the surgery option. I'm in a major city with Kaiser and meet with the surgeon next week. The use the Da Vinci method almost exclusively, so I'm guessing they have done many of these. ...not too keen on being irradiated as I've heard it eliminates the surgery option if the cancer comes back later on...true?
Posts.Title: newbe

Posts.Content: Just diagnosed...My doctor recommends surgery...I'm new at this and was wondering what kinds of things others have done at this point...I've had a PSA of 495...Gleason of 6 on one side and 7 on the other...thanks..

Posts.Content: Yes, thanks. this is the result of my tests. is the 'watching and waiting' even an option? PSA 4.94 3/20/2013 PSA 5.52 6/4/2012 Prostate exam normal FINAL DIAGNOSIS: I. Prostate, right, needle biopsies: -- Gleason 3+3 score 6 prostatic adenocarcinoma with tumor present in 5 of 6 cores with tumor comprising an estimated 40% of total tissue submitted. II. Prostate, left, needle core biopsies: -- Gleason 3+4 score 7 prostatic adenocarcinoma with tumor present in 3 of 6 cores with tumor comprising an estimated 25% of total tissue submitted.
